title.narrative: DFID Peace Support Fund - Local Resilience for Peace

description.narrative: LRP aims to reduce inter-communal violence (ICV) in Myanmar by strengthening local resiliencies for peace in two regional hubs (Mandalay/Meiktila & Taunggyi). In partnership with Swe Tha Har, Mercy Corps will strengthen the ability of local leaders to work across ethnic and religious lines to resolve inter-communal disputes (Objective 1), and strengthen the ability of civil society organisations (CSOs) and activists to assess local dynamics, design and implement projects to promote tolerance and reconciliation, and network with local authorities (Objective 2). By building local networks of effective, diverse actors with an interest in promoting peaceful multi-ethnic, multi-religious communities, the project seeks to lay the foundation for locally-led monitoring, prevention, and response to ICV.

Objective 1: Strengthen the ability of diverse local leaders to work across ethnic and religious lines of division to resolve disputes. • Activity 1.1: Actor mapping and selection of 40 local leaders (20 per regional hub) • Activity 1.2: Dispute resolution training for 40 local leaders • Activity 1.3: Quarterly exchange meetings (3 meetings per regional hub) • Activity 1.4: Dispute Resolution Monitoring • Activity 1.5: Small grants to support the dispute resolution process and the implementation of negotiated agreements
Objective 2: Empower local civil society organisations and activists to prevent inter-communal violence by promoting tolerance and networking with local authorities. • Activity 2.1: Mapping and selection of 8 CSOs and activists • Activity 2.2: CSO-led participatory assessments • Activity 2.3: Training on strategies for promoting tolerance • Activity 2.4: Development and implementation of tolerance and reconciliation projects • Activity 2.5: Facilitation of meetings between CSOs and government leaders

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity

sector.narrative: Conflict Prevention and Resolution/Peace and Security
